title: Director, Head of Platform Engineering
shortDescription:
- Lead Platform + Cloud Engineering; focus on DevOps/platform practices in AWS/Azure.
- Own CI/CD, IaC, monitoring/logging/alerting, DR/security/compliance.
- Mentions AWS ECS/Fargate/EC2; Python/Django apps; Kafka/Elastic/Redis.
- Mix of leadership + hands-on (role estimates include ~35% development).
fitRationale:
- Enterprise IT/platform leadership with strong governance + reliability requirements (finance).
- Good fit if you want a platform leadership role with meaningful hands-on architecture influence.
- Smaller org than your current scope, but operational rigor and compliance are aligned.

title: Vice President, Engineering
shortDescription:
- VP Eng reporting to CTO; build technical capabilities that accelerate clinical trials/drug dev.
- Heavy on data ingestion + RWE platforms + modeling/prediction pipelines.
- Explicit governance/compliance: GxP validation, security compliance, regulatory-first posture.
- Mentions LLM-integrated features + autonomous agents.
fitRationale:
- Great match on AI + data platform + governance/compliance posture (regulated workflows).
- True org leadership role (15+ engineers) with cross-functional C-level partnership.
- Downside: biotech/pharma domain focus; not traditional enterprise SaaS.

title: Head of Engineering (Platform)
shortDescription:
- Exec role reporting to CTO; lead Platform/Insurance group (eligibility, claims, billing, payments).
- Own org design + scaling multiple engineering pods.
- Emphasis on reliability/security in complex regulated domains.
- Mentions growth from ~150 to 250+ engineers.
fitRationale:
- Strong platform exec role with compliance-ish domain complexity (insurance/payments).
- Direct match to scaling high-impact platforms and operating model design.
- Not classic enterprise software, but the platform + regulated complexity fits your themes.

title: Sr. Director, Data Platform Engineering & Operations
shortDescription:
- Lead SIE’s Data + AI platform ecosystem (streaming/ingestion/warehouse, governance/observability).
- Operate at massive scale (millions of users; billions of data points/day).
- Stack mentions: Kafka, Databricks, Snowflake; governance tools (Alation/Collibra).
- Bay Area role (San Mateo).
fitRationale:
- Very aligned with enterprise-scale data/platform leadership + governance/observability.
- Strong bridge to AI platform strategy (Databricks/Snowflake + AI/ML adoption).
- Big-org, cross-functional exec leadership similar to your OpenText scope.

title: Senior Vice President of Engineering
shortDescription:
- Lead global engineering for Zeenea data-intelligence / data catalog platform within Actian.
- Own engineering vision/strategy; align product roadmap with delivery/excellence.
- Explicit focus on AI strategy, connectivity, and cloud operations (scale + performance).
- Drive modern practices: CI/CD, DevOps, observability, automation.
fitRationale:
- Direct match to enterprise data platform + metadata/governance themes (data intelligence).
- Exec-level operating model work (process/tooling/culture) is squarely in your lane.
- HCL/Actian scale helps if you want a larger enterprise context vs. early-stage.

title: VP, Technology Engineering
shortDescription:
- VP role supporting President + Construction/Operations; tech engineering for data center design decisions.
- Own tech selection/evaluations (TCO, MTBF, EOL timelines) and SLA inputs with vendors.
- Deep physical infra scope: electrical/mechanical/security/fire/structural within data centers.
- Heavy exec communication: translate engineering tradeoffs to business decisions.
fitRationale:
- Enterprise-scale reliability/availability mindset (SLA, MTBF, lifecycle) maps to platform resilience.
- Less software/platform than your core profile; more hardware + facilities engineering.
- Consider if you want a pivot into infrastructure-heavy leadership with strong governance/security posture.

title: Chief Architect
shortDescription:
- Transformation role: lead multi-year modernization from monolith to AWS cloud-native microservices.
- Own architectural governance (standards, decision-making, review) and exec-level roadmap translation.
- Guide parallel-run migration strategy (legacy + modern), balancing tech debt vs new capabilities.
- Partner with security/ops/product; explicitly mentions AI-driven product capabilities.
fitRationale:
- Strong fit for your platform modernization + governance + executive alignment strengths.
- Cloud-native architecture leadership with clear value on operating model + standards at scale.
- Good narrative for ‘trust at scale’: migration, reliability, compliance, and AI capability delivery.

title: Senior Vice President of Data & Infrastructure
shortDescription:
- Report to CTO; oversee 80–100 engineers across data infrastructure (ingestion, prediction, measurement, exchanges).
- Own build/buy/partner strategy for data + infra; drive impact across ambiguous problem spaces.
- Lead a US-based remote engineering org with strong cross-functional collaboration.
- Healthcare context (quality + cost outcomes) implies high governance/privacy requirements.
fitRationale:
- Very aligned to enterprise data platform leadership + AI/analytics enablement at org scale.
- Strong ‘data as product’ leadership role with room to shape governance, standards, and execution rigor.
- Domain is healthcare (regulated), which matches your governance/compliance focus.

title: Chief Architect (VA Enrollment System modernization)
shortDescription:
- Own enterprise architecture for VA Enrollment System modernization + integration (EDB/IVM/VistA REE).
- Design scalable, secure microservices/APIs/data pipelines for high-volume eligibility/enrollment.
- Heavy compliance: FedRAMP, FISMA, IRS 1075, HIPAA; drive DevSecOps + CI/CD automation.
- Lead incident response oversight and resilience; mentor teams and approve deliverables.
fitRationale:
- Strong match to ‘trust at scale’ (security/compliance/sovereignty) and platform modernization.
- Government customer context emphasizes governance, interoperability, and auditability.
- Tradeoff: contractor + contingent award; compensation band is lower than typical exec roles.

title: Chief Technology Officer
shortDescription:
- Own technology vision, architecture, and execution as the company scales platform + AI products.
- Partner with CEO/leadership on roadmap, resourcing, and technical strategy.
- Lead engineering org and drive delivery, reliability, and security practices.
- Focused on applied AI + data platforms for customer impact.
fitRationale:
- Matches your enterprise AI/platform leadership strengths, especially if you want a tighter CEO/CTO partnership.
- Good venue to operationalize governance, reliability, and AI productization in a smaller org.
- Company scale is below your usual enterprise sweet spot, but scope is end-to-end tech leadership.
